verses.verse: Now <S%G1161><s%> faith <S%G4102><s%> is the assurance <S%G5287><s%> of [things <S%G4229><s%>] hoped <S%G1679><s%> for, the conviction <S%G1650><s%> of things not seen. <S%G991><s%>
For by it the men <S%G4245><s%> of old <S%G4245><s%> gained <S%G3140><s%> approval. <S%G3140><s%>

By faith <S%G4102><s%> Enoch <S%G1802><s%> was taken <S%G3346><s%> up so that he should not see <S%G3708><s%> death; <S%G2288><s%> and he was not found <S%G2147><s%> because <S%G1360><s%> God <S%G2316><s%> took <S%G3346><s%> him up; for he obtained <S%G3140><s%> the witness <S%G3140><s%> that before <S%G4253><s%> his being <S%G3331><s%> taken <S%G3331><s%> up he was pleasing <S%G2100><s%> to God. <S%G2316><s%>

And without <S%G5565><s%> faith <S%G4102><s%> it is impossible <S%G102><s%> to please <S%G2100><s%> [Him], for he who comes <S%G4334><s%> to God <S%G2316><s%> must <S%G1163><s%> believe <S%G4100><s%> that He is, and [that] He is a rewarder <S%G3406><s%> of those <S%G3588><s%> who seek <S%G1567><s%> Him.

By faith <S%G4102><s%> Noah, <S%G3575><s%> being warned <S%G5537><s%> [by God] about <S%G4012><s%> things not yet <S%G3369><s%> seen, <S%G991><s%> in reverence <S%G2125><s%> prepared <S%G2680><s%> an ark <S%G2787><s%> for the salvation <S%G4991><s%> of his household, <S%G3624><s%> by which <S%G3739><s%> he condemned <S%G2632><s%> the world, <S%G2889><s%> and became <S%G1096><s%> an heir <S%G2818><s%> of the righteousness <S%G1343><s%> which is according <S%G2596><s%> to faith. <S%G4102><s%>

By faith <S%G4102><s%> Abraham, <S%G11><s%> when he was called, <S%G2564><s%> obeyed <S%G5219><s%> by going <S%G1831><s%> out to a place <S%G5117><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> he was to receive <S%G2983><s%> for an inheritance; <S%G2817><s%> and he went <S%G1831><s%> out, not knowing <S%G1987><s%> where <S%G4226><s%> he was going. <S%G2064><s%>

By faith <S%G4102><s%> he lived <S%G3939><s%> as an alien <S%G3939><s%> in the land <S%G1093><s%> of promise, <S%G1860><s%> as in a foreign <S%G245><s%> [land], dwelling <S%G2730><s%> in tents <S%G4633><s%> with Isaac <S%G2464><s%> and Jacob, <S%G2384><s%> fellow <S%G4789><s%> heirs <S%G4789><s%> of the same <S%G846><s%> promise; <S%G1860><s%>

for he was looking <S%G1551><s%> for the city <S%G4172><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> has <S%G2192><s%> foundations, <S%G2310><s%> whose <S%G3739><s%> architect <S%G5079><s%> and builder <S%G1217><s%> is God. <S%G2316><s%>

therefore, <S%G1352><s%> also, <S%G2532><s%> there was born <S%G1096><s%> of one <S%G1520><s%> man, <S%G1520><s%> and him as good as dead <S%G3499><s%> at that, [as many descendants] as the stars <S%G798><s%> of heaven <S%G3772><s%> in number, <S%G4128><s%> and innumerable <S%G382><s%> as the sand <S%G285><s%> which is by the seashore. <S%G2281><s%>

All <S%G3956><s%> these <S%G3778><s%> died <S%G599><s%> in faith, <S%G4102><s%> without <S%G3361><s%> receiving <S%G2865><s%> the promises, <S%G1860><s%> but having seen <S%G3708><s%> them and having welcomed <S%G782><s%> them from a distance, <S%G4207><s%> and having confessed <S%G3670><s%> that they were strangers <S%G3581><s%> and exiles <S%G3927><s%> on the earth. <S%G1093><s%>

For those <S%G3588><s%> who say <S%G3004><s%> such <S%G5108><s%> things <S%G5108><s%> make <S%G1718><s%> it clear <S%G1718><s%> that they are seeking <S%G1934><s%> a country <S%G3968><s%> of their own. <S%G3968><s%>

And indeed <S%G3303><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> they had been thinking <S%G3421><s%> of that [country] from which <S%G3739><s%> they went <S%G7057><s%> out, they would have had <S%G2192><s%> opportunity <S%G2540><s%> to return. <S%G344><s%>

But as it is, they desire <S%G3713><s%> a better <S%G2909><s%> [country], that is a heavenly <S%G2032><s%> one. <S%G2032><s%> Therefore <S%G1352><s%> God <S%G2316><s%> is not ashamed <S%G1870><s%> to be called <S%G1941><s%> their God; <S%G2316><s%> for He has prepared <S%G2090><s%> a city <S%G4172><s%> for them.

By faith <S%G4102><s%> Abraham, <S%G11><s%> when he was tested, <S%G3985><s%> offered <S%G4374><s%> up Isaac; <S%G2464><s%> and he who had received <S%G324><s%> the promises <S%G1860><s%> was offering <S%G4374><s%> up his only <S%G3439><s%> begotten <S%G3439><s%> [son];
[it was he] to whom <S%G3739><s%> it was said, <S%G2980><s%> "In Isaac <S%G2464><s%> your descendants <S%G4690><s%> shall be called. <S%G2564><s%>"

He considered <S%G3049><s%> that God <S%G2316><s%> is able <S%G1415><s%> to raise <S%G1453><s%> [men] even <S%G2532><s%> from the dead; <S%G3498><s%> from which <S%G3606><s%> he also <S%G2532><s%> received <S%G2865><s%> him back <S%G2865><s%> as a type. <S%G3850><s%>
By faith <S%G4102><s%> Isaac <S%G2464><s%> blessed <S%G2127><s%> Jacob <S%G2384><s%> and Esau, <S%G2269><s%> even <S%G2532><s%> regarding <S%G4012><s%> things <S%G3195><s%> to come. <S%G3195><s%>

By faith <S%G4102><s%> Jacob, <S%G2384><s%> as he was dying, <S%G599><s%> blessed <S%G2127><s%> each <S%G1538><s%> of the sons <S%G5207><s%> of Joseph, <S%G2501><s%> and worshiped, <S%G4352><s%> [leaning] on the top <S%G206><s%> of his staff. <S%G4464><s%>

By faith <S%G4102><s%> Joseph, <S%G2501><s%> when he was dying, <S%G5053><s%> made <S%G3421><s%> mention <S%G3421><s%> of the exodus <S%G1841><s%> of the sons <S%G5207><s%> of Israel, <S%G2474><s%> and gave <S%G1781><s%> orders <S%G1781><s%> concerning <S%G4012><s%> his bones. <S%G3747><s%>

By faith <S%G4102><s%> Moses, <S%G3475><s%> when he was born, <S%G1080><s%> was hidden <S%G2928><s%> for three <S%G5150><s%> months <S%G5150><s%> by his parents, <S%G3962><s%> because <S%G1360><s%> they saw <S%G3708><s%> he was a beautiful <S%G791><s%> child; <S%G3813><s%> and they were not afraid <S%G5399><s%> of the king's edict. <S%G1297><s%>

By faith <S%G4102><s%> Moses, <S%G3475><s%> when he had grown <S%G3173><s%> <S%G1096><s%> up, refused <S%G720><s%> to be called <S%G3004><s%> the son <S%G5207><s%> of Pharaoh's daughter; <S%G2364><s%>

considering <S%G2233><s%> the reproach <S%G3680><s%> of Christ <S%G5547><s%> greater <S%G3173><s%> riches <S%G4149><s%> than the treasures <S%G2344><s%> of Egypt; <S%G125><s%> for he was looking <S%G578><s%> to the reward. <S%G3405><s%>

By faith <S%G4102><s%> he left <S%G2641><s%> Egypt, <S%G125><s%> not fearing <S%G5399><s%> the wrath <S%G2372><s%> of the king; <S%G935><s%> for he endured, <S%G2594><s%> as seeing <S%G3708><s%> Him who is unseen. <S%G517><s%>

By faith <S%G4102><s%> he kept <S%G4160><s%> the Passover <S%G3957><s%> and the sprinkling <S%G4378><s%> of the blood, <S%G129><s%> so <S%G2443><s%> that he who destroyed <S%G3639><s%> the first-born might not touch <S%G2345><s%> them.

By faith <S%G4102><s%> they passed <S%G1224><s%> through <S%G1224><s%> the Red <S%G2063><s%> Sea <S%G2281><s%> as though <S%G5613><s%> [they were passing] through <S%G1223><s%> dry <S%G3584><s%> land; <S%G1093><s%> and the Egyptians, <S%G124><s%> when they attempted <S%G3984><s%> <S%G2983><s%> it, were drowned. <S%G2666><s%>

By faith <S%G4102><s%> Rahab <S%G4460><s%> the harlot <S%G4204><s%> did not perish <S%G4881><s%> along <S%G4881><s%> with those <S%G3588><s%> who were disobedient, <S%G544><s%> after she had welcomed <S%G1209><s%> the spies <S%G2685><s%> in peace. <S%G1515><s%>

And what <S%G5101><s%> more <S%G2089><s%> shall I say <S%G3004><s%>? For time <S%G5550><s%> will fail <S%G1952><s%> me if I tell <S%G1334><s%> of Gideon, <S%G1066><s%> Barak, <S%G913><s%> Samson, <S%G4546><s%> Jephthah, <S%G2422><s%> of David <S%G7035><s%> and Samuel <S%G4545><s%> and the prophets, <S%G4396><s%>

quenched <S%G4570><s%> the power <S%G1411><s%> of fire, <S%G4442><s%> escaped <S%G5343><s%> the edge <S%G4750><s%> of the sword, <S%G3162><s%> from weakness <S%G769><s%> were made <S%G1412><s%> strong, <S%G1412><s%> became <S%G1096><s%> mighty <S%G2478><s%> in war, <S%G4171><s%> put <S%G2827><s%> foreign <S%G245><s%> armies <S%G3925><s%> to flight. <S%G2827><s%>

Women <S%G1135><s%> received <S%G2983><s%> [back] their dead <S%G3498><s%> by resurrection; <S%G386><s%> and others <S%G243><s%> were tortured, <S%G5178><s%> not accepting <S%G4327><s%> their release, <S%G629><s%> in order <S%G2443><s%> that they might obtain <S%G5177><s%> a better <S%G2909><s%> resurrection; <S%G386><s%>

and others <S%G2087><s%> experienced <S%G2983><s%> <S%G3984><s%> mockings <S%G1701><s%> and scourgings, <S%G3148><s%> yes, <S%G2089><s%> also <S%G1161><s%> chains <S%G1199><s%> and imprisonment. <S%G5438><s%>

They were stoned, <S%G3034><s%> they were sawn <S%G4249><s%> in two, <S%G4249><s%> they were tempted, <S%G3985><s%> they were put <S%G599><s%> to death <S%G599><s%> <S%G1722><s%> <S%G5408><s%> with the sword; <S%G3162><s%> they went <S%G4022><s%> about <S%G4022><s%> in sheepskins, <S%G3374><s%> in goatskins, <S%G122><s%> <S%G1192><s%> being destitute, <S%G5302><s%> afflicted, <S%G2346><s%> ill-treated

([men] of whom <S%G3739><s%> the world <S%G2889><s%> was not worthy <S%G514><s%>), wandering <S%G4105><s%> in deserts <S%G2047><s%> and mountains <S%G3735><s%> and caves <S%G4693><s%> and holes <S%G3692><s%> in the ground. <S%G1093><s%>
